intro: Pleiogyne multifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, typically growing on the branches of host trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often clustered in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host plants if left unchecked.
